paragraphs.text:
%md
# Project 3: Data Thieves - Where to work after the bootcamp?
## The visualisations
We're using zeppeling in order to beautifully plot the data we got from the webscraping and the csv files.

msg.data:
Project 3: Data Thieves - Where to work after the bootcamp?

The visualisations

We’re using zeppeling in order to beautifully plot the data we got from the webscraping and the csv files.

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### Importing the data and the libraries

msg.data: Importing the data and the libraries

paragraphs.text:
# importing the libraries and files
import pandas as pd
import re

salaries = pd.read_csv("/Users/miquelpetitsierra/Desktop/Ironhack/M1/Project-Week-3-Data-Thieves/data/df_salaries_corrected.csv", index_col=0)
avg_quality = pd.read_csv("/Users/miquelpetitsierra/Desktop/Ironhack/M1/Project-Week-3-Data-Thieves/data/df_cost_quality_cleaned.csv", index_col=0)
countries = pd.read_csv("/Users/miquelpetitsierra/Desktop/Ironhack/M1/Project-Week-3-Data-Thieves/data/df_country.csv", index_col=0)
jobs = pd.read_csv("/Users/miquelpetitsierra/Desktop/Ironhack/M1/Project-Week-3-Data-Thieves/data/df_job_cleaned.csv", index_col=0)

%md
## First, for which job are we comparing the countries?
Before we get to answer the question of which is the best country to work after the bootcamp, we first need to choose the job we'll compare. We have taken the Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Financial Analyst, and we have also separed it by the experience so we get closer to the reality: Junior, Experienced and Senior.

We have designed the following plot aiming to compare the jobs by experience so the data is more similar, it wouldn't make sense to compare the salary of a Senior job with a Junior job.

msg.data:
First, for which job are we comparing the countries?

Before we get to answer the question of which is the best country to work after the bootcamp, we first need to choose the job we’ll compare. We have taken the Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Financial Analyst, and we have also separed it by the experience so we get closer to the reality: Junior, Experienced and Senior.

We have designed the following plot aiming to compare the jobs by experience so the data is more similar, it wouldn’t make sense to compare the salary of a Senior job with a Junior job.

paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT * FROM salaries join countries on salaries.country_id = countries.country_id  join avg_quality on salaries.country_id = avg_quality.country_id join jobs on salaries.job_id = jobs.job_id order by salaries.Salary DESC

paragraphs.title: Job's salaries compared

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Once chosen the job, where is it better to work?
In each of the following three graphs, for each of the jobs, we plot the data of the salaries by countries and experience. In this way, we can see in which countries that job is better paid. As all the salaries are not comparable in different countries, the measure we are taking is the "absolute wealth", simply calculated subtracting the average living cost of each country to the salary of each job. That's why there can be some columns in negative.

msg.data:
Once chosen the job, where is it better to work?

In each of the following three graphs, for each of the jobs, we plot the data of the salaries by countries and experience. In this way, we can see in which countries that job is better paid. As all the salaries are not comparable in different countries, the measure we are taking is the “absolute wealth”, simply calculated subtracting the average living cost of each country to the salary of each job. That’s why there can be some columns in negative.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Data Analyst
The average salaries from Spain and France do not follow the logical trend of being higher with more experience. This can be explained as in the Glassdoor portal we scraped it says this data has low confidence.

msg.data:
Data Analyst

The average salaries from Spain and France do not follow the logical trend of being higher with more experience. This can be explained as in the Glassdoor portal we scraped it says this data has low confidence.

paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT *, (salaries.Salary - avg_quality.avg_living_costs) as absolute_wealth FROM salaries join countries on salaries.country_id = countries.country_id  join avg_quality on salaries.country_id = avg_quality.country_id join jobs on salaries.job_id = jobs.job_id WHERE jobs.job =="Data Analyst" order by salaries.Salary DESC
